thread.title: Floor Test: TN Assembly turns into a 'House of Shame'
thread.title_full: Floor Test: TN Assembly turns into a 'House of Shame'

title: Floor Test: TN Assembly turns into a 'House of Shame'
text:
It was another dramatic day in Tamil Nadu politics. Pandemonium reigned in the TN assembly on Saturday when opposition parties demanded a secret ballot to decide the fate of Chief Minister Edappadi K. Palaniswami, who was sworn in on Thursday. 
A look at some of the reactions... There you go. Seems like we have another CM. Jai de-mockcrazy — Kamal Haasan (@ikamalhaasan) February 18, 2017 TN MLAs grabbing mikes, throwing chairs, jumping on speaker's table. North-south divide bridged today. Remember UP 1998! #Shame — Rajdeep Sardesai (@sardesairajdeep) February 18, 2017 With dramatically open shirt, Stalin has launched his election campaign. — Sreenivasan Jain (@SreenivasanJain) February 18, 2017 After meeting Governor, the DMK strongman and opposition leader @mkstalin 2 go on fast at the #Marina . #TNTrustVote pic.twitter.com/u1PGge0z8y — Sreedhar Pillai (@sri50) February 18, 2017 Back to 1980s for TN! Remember how Jayalalithaa was roughed up inside the assembly? #Shame — Rajdeep Sardesai (@sardesairajdeep) February 18, 2017 Everyone in Tamil Nadu: Be safe. The state is now completely in the hands of Mannargudi Mafia. Anything can happen #floortest — Not TTV Dinakaran (@dinakaran) February 18, 2017 News comes in that voting on confidence vote is going on without the Opposition. This is a farce and undemocratic. — Sumanth Raman (@sumanthraman) February 18, 2017 Proxy of proxy. — Dhanya Rajendran (@dhanyarajendran) February 18, 2017 Earlier visuals of broken tables and torn pieces of paper near #Speaker 's chair in Tamil Nadu Assembly #floortest https://t.co/88Gt8F2NS8 pic.twitter.com/6A4vsfs5Nh
